item.title: Bandai Namco Reveals Stylish Roguelike, Towa And The Guardians Of The Sacred Tree
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/bandai-namco-reveals-stylish-roguelike-towa-and-the-guardians-of-the-sacred-tree/1100-6532212/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Bandai Namco premiered a handful of new titles during Summer Game Fest 2025, including a new, anime-inspired roguelike called Towa and the Guardians of the Sacred Tree, which is coming to all major platforms this September.

Described as "a game drawing from classic Japanese art with a whimsical spin on Eastern mysticism," Towa and the Guardians of the Sacred Tree pits players in the role of the titular priestess, who embarks on a journey alongside one of eight other guardians to defeat the evil Magatsu.

Towa and another guardian work cooperatively as a duo, delving into dungeons and battling Magatsu's minions together. According to Bandai Namco, "Each guardian has its own abilities and set of swords, making each combat style and guardian pair unique."

Between quests, players will spend time in a village, which develops over the course of the game. "As the guardians pursue their quests across different timelines, the village evolves over the years. Develop unique bonds with its residents and learn more about their customs and stories that are woven into the inner workings of the village," Bandai Namco explains.

Towa and the Guardians of the Sacred Tree launches for PS5, Xbox Series X|S, PC, and Nintendo Switch on September 19. The game supports solo play as well as local and online co-op.

item.title: Indonesian Beat-'Em-Up Acts Of Blood Gives Raid Vibes During Summer Game Fest
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/indonesian-beat-em-up-acts-of-blood-gives-raid-vibes-during-summer-game-fest/1100-6532214/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

After almost a year of beta testing, Indonesian developer Fajrul FN dropped a new trailer for their new indie beat-'em-up Acts of Blood during Summer Game Fest 2025.

Set in a hazy southeast Asian dystopia, the game focuses on a young man attempting to avenge his dead father against a seemingly infinite number of hard-hitting criminals. Our hero, however, looks like he hits harder. The combat appears to be very much influenced by the recent slate of absolutely brutal Indonesian martial arts flicks, such as Gareth Evans' The Raid, or Timo Tjahjanto's The Night Comes For Us. Gameplay-wise, though, Acts of Blood appears to be taking its cues from the free-flowing mechanics of Sloclap's Sifu, another unique take on beat-'em-ups pitting a lone fighter against a keen-to-kill swarm of enemies, except Acts of Bloods hero apparently isn't above laying waste to his enemies with the nearest baseball bat, crowbar or shotgun.

All that combines with a hint of Mirror's Edge-style parkour across the city. There even appears to be a direct homage to The Raid 2's infamous prison courtyard fight. That means, a lot of hectic, bonecrushing hand-to-hand fights, narrow acrobatic escapes from the authorities, and, apparently, one badass jacket.

The game is due out on Steam in Summer 2026. Check out the trailer below.

item.title: Out of Words Is A Charming And Colorful Co-Op Stop-Motion Adventure
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/out-of-words-is-a-charming-colorful-co-op-stop-motion-adventure/1100-6532210/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Epic Games Publishing announced Wiredfly and Kong Orange's Out of Words during Summer Game Fest, a co-op side-scrolling action-adventure game. The characters have lost their mouths--and the ability to speak--and must work together during their colorful journey as they engage with a variety of challenges. A distinguishing feature is that all of the characters and environments have been crafted and animated using traditional, physical stop-motion animation, with the trailer showing part of the creation process for characters.

The game is based on an original concept by Danish poet Morten Søndergaard. The two leads, Kurt and Karla, find themselves in the fantastical realm of Vokabulantis, where they must work together to overcome the various challenges in their way. While the two are described as "friends," there are hints that the game will see their relationship blossom in a more romantic way.

The game features both online and local co-op play. Despite the leads' wordless nature in-game, you'll need to communicate with your co-op partner in order to solve puzzles. Puzzles shown in the trailer include elements like shifting gravity and using a grappling device to traverse the side-scrolling landscapes.

Out of Words is planned for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC via the Epic Games Store. No details on potential cross-play or a release date have yet been given.

item.title: Drinkbox Studios Unveils Blighted
item.content:encoded:
https://gameinformer.com/sgf-2025/2025/06/06/drinkbox-studios-unveils-blighted

Drinkbox Studios has a strong track record at this point from prior releases like the Guacamelee games, Severed, and Nobody Saves the World. Studio co-founder Graham Smith claims that the newly announced Blighted is the team’s “largest and most ambitious game to date.”

Revealed for the first time during today’s Summer Game Fest presentation, Blighted is an isometric action/RPG that calls to mind games like Hades at first glance, but the developers actually cite Metroidvania games as a core direction. 

Playable either solo or cooperatively, the game focuses on a lone survivor who must retrieve the lost memories of his destroyed village after a being named Sorcisto has consumed them. Blighted features a focus on precise and fast-moving combat built around combos and finishers, and your own Blight acts as a dynamic difficulty scaler that changes enemies, your own character, and the surrounding world. 

Blighted is being scored by Jim Guthrie, whose prior work includes titles like Superbrothers: Sword & Sworcery EP, Below, and Nobody Saves the World. 

Based on both the concept and the pedigree of the studio, this feels like a title worth watching closely. 

Blighted doesn’t yet have a release date, but the developer shared that we can expect it to arrive on Steam.

item.title: Neil Patrick Harris Stars In Newly Announced Deadpool VR
item.content:encoded:
https://gameinformer.com/sgf-2025/2025/06/06/neil-patrick-harris-stars-in-newly-announced-deadpool-vr

Hot off the character’s success in last year’s big Marvel movie, Deadpool is coming to the video game world with Deadpool VR. Neil Patrick Harris is stepping into the leading role, and based on the banter from this reveal, he’s got a strong handle on the irreverent tone of the sometimes-hero. 

It’s a surprise to see a VR title for such a high-profile Marvel superhero franchise, but the involvement of developer Twisted Pixel gives good reason to be hopeful. Through titles like ‘Splosion Man and Comic Jumper, the team established solid cred for doing goofy humor, and that same team has done work on VR in its more recent releases. 

Based on the initial trailer, Deadpool VR appears to feature a thematically appropriate mix of weird characters, extreme violence, and idiotic humor. The gameplay shown appears to be first-person shooting and other actions, such as driving and traversal. 

Deadpool VR is targeting a release later this year, and you’ll only be able to play on Meta Quest 3 and 3S. 

Check out the age-restricted full trailer on YouTube.

item.title: Scott Pilgrim EX Is A New Throwback Beat 'Em Up
item.content:encoded:
https://gameinformer.com/sgf-2025/2025/06/06/scott-pilgrim-ex-is-a-new-throwback-beat-em-up

Scott Pilgrim is making a comeback via video game. The film came out years ago, and the comic has also been complete for some time, but the recent Netflix anime has shown that there is still an appetite for Scott and pals' adventures.

When it was shown on stage at the Summer Game Fest presentation, Geoff Keighley stopped short of calling it a sequel, but a new pixelated Scott Pilgrim beat 'em up is coming soon. Scott Pilgrim EX features music from Anamanaguchi (the creators of the soundtrack for the Scott Pilgrim vs. The World video game), and has a story by Scott Pilgrim's creator, Bryan Lee O'Malley. Confirmed playable characters are Scott and Ramona, but there will be five mysterious others. The game will also feature four-player co-op.

The game is being developed by Tribute Games, the team behind the upcoming Marvel: Cosmic Invasion and the critically acclaimed Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shredder's Revenge.

item.title: Dying Light: The Beast Launches In August And Gets A New Trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://gameinformer.com/sgf-2025/2025/06/06/dying-light-the-beast-launches-in-august-and-gets-a-new-trailer

Kyle Crane makes his big return in Dying Light: The Beast, a standalone adventure originally envisioned as an expansion to Dying Light 2. A new trailer that premiered during Summer Game Fest revealed the game is coming on August 22.

Original Dying Light protagonist Kyle Crane has been captured and experimented on by the Baron. He escapes, but has gained new powers from the zombie DNA now coursing his veins. Set in the new world of Castor Woods, players must utilize their new abilities and Kyle's parkour prowess to take down the Baron, either alone or in four-player co-op.

Dying Light: The Beast will cost $39.99, though it will be free for owners of the Ultimate Edition of Dying Light 2 Stay Human. Look for the game on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC.

item.title: Mecha Break gets a July 1 release date reveal at Summer Game Fest
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/mecha-break-gets-a-july-1-release-date-reveal-at-summer-game-fest

Mecha Break has just got a release date revealed at Summer Game Fest! It'll launch on July 1 on Steam and Xbox Series X|S.

This reveal came with a lengthy cinematic trailer in which a whole lot of robot action happened, some sad lad hanging out in a ruined city dropped a dog tag, and then hopped into his own mech to fly about and shoot lasers. It was pretty cool! You can watch the trailer below.

Mecha Break proved exceptionally popular on Steam when it held an open beta test earlier this year, and it was great fun too. You can play standard PvP matches against an opposing team of mech pilots, or alternatively head into the battle royale Mashmak mode.

item.title: Survival horror game ILL gets a trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/06/06/survival-horror-game-ill-gets-its-first-proper-trailer/

Summer Gamesfest continues with the first proper look at ILL,a narrative-driven first-person survival horror game that transports you to a sinister settlement where the inhabitants have gone bonkers, removed most of their clothes and want to eat your face, so a bit like Liverpool city centre at 4am.

Here’s more from the Steam page for the game:

“Prepare to embrace new boundaries of horror. ILL offers a visceral and realistic depiction of body horror: disgusting, monstrous creatures can be gruesomely dismembered and traumatized. Torn flesh, exposed bones, and gutted organs—all combine to create an unprecedented and vicious experience that will leave you breathless.”

“Your enemies are cunning and unpredictable. They don’t remain in a constant state of attack but suffer pain and react to all manner of events. Hits on different enemy body parts elicit unique reactions, replete with animations and visual effects. Enemies’ appearance will vary with diverse textures, proportions, and animations — you’ll never know what twisted form your adversaries will take next.”

“Experience a comprehensive weapon system where malfunction checks, ammunition types, and mandatory maintenance are crucial. Feel the weight and realism of each weapon in the protagonist’s hands, thanks to procedural animation that considers physical characteristics. The game’s world offers a range of ammo and weapon upgrades, demanding strategic choices for survival. Stay sharp, as every decision can mean the difference between life and death.”

“ILL will captivate you with its physically believable world, teeming with rich possibilities of interaction. Manipulate objects, navigate through intricate levels, and experience the consequential effects of real-world physics in gameplay and combat. This means the game’s world is not just a backdrop but an integral part of the gameplay experience, drawing you deeper into the terrifying reality of the town and its deadly creatures.”

ILL will launch on PC, no console versions have been announced yet.

Source: YouTube

item.title: Action adventure game Mixtape gets a new trailer and a superb 80s soundtrack
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/06/06/action-adventure-game-mixtape-gets-a-new-trailer-and-a-superb-80s-soundtrack/

On their last night together, three friends embark on one final adventure and you get to play it all while listening to an era-defining collection of songs from the likes of DEVO, Roxy Music, Lush, The Smashing Pumpkins, Iggy Pop, Siouxsie and the Banshees, Joy Division, the Cure and many more.

“En route to their final party together, a perfectly curated playlist draws three friends into dreamlike reenactments of their formative memories. Experience a variety of narrative vignettes exploring the pivotal moments that shaped them. Players will immerse themselves in the teenage wasteland by playing through a mixtape of joyful gameplay, from skateboarding and flying to taking photos after hours at an abandoned theme park, hitting baseballs, and putting on a fireworks show from the backseat of a car. It’s the greatest hits of the teenage experience, from the first kiss to the last dance.”

“From Beethoven & Dinosaur, developers of BAFTA award-winning game The Artful Escape, Mixtape draws inspiration from classic coming-of-age movies, bringing together nostalgic aimlessness, mischief, music, the highs and lows of adolescence, and the bittersweet feelings brought about by growth, transformation, and moving on.”

Mixtape is coming soon on PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S.

Source: YouTube

item.title: Mina The Hollower Release Date Announced, Demo Now Available On Steam
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/mina-the-hollower-release-date-announced-demo-now-available-on-steam/

Mina the Hollower, the next game from legendary indie developers Yacht Club Games, the team behind beloved 2D platformer Shovel Knight, finally has a release date. It'll arrive on PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X/S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch and PC on October 31, 2025.

Since Shovel Knight launched, Yacht Club has only made Shovel Knight-related games, with a brief publishing stint to publish Cyber Shadow. Mina the Hollower is the first non-shovel-related game developed by Yacht Club in a decade.

Thankfully, players who've been waiting for something totally new from Yacht Club for years don't have to wait entirely until October 31 to try out Mina the Hollower, as there's a demo available on PC right now.

Whereas Shovel Knight had his shovel, Mina the Hollower has her whip and digging abilities, and by the look of the trailer, there will still be plenty of platforming for players to enjoy.

Yacht Club games is arguably one of the best indie developers in the industry right now, so expectations for everything they make are set very high. After so long without anything not involving a shovel, it'll be interesting to see how Mina the Hollower lands with players when it arrives this coming Halloween.

item.title: Body horror shooter Ill shows more of its naked monsters getting de-limbed
item.content:encoded:
https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/body-horror-shooter-ill-shows-more-of-its-naked-monsters-getting-de-limbed

Cronenburgian body horror shooter Ill shared more sick filth at the Summer Game Fest, with a trailer that shows the freakish pale abominations you'll be dismembering as you travel through some horrifying concrete manifestation of your own unwellness. Ah, no wait, it's a fort where bad experiments happened. My bad, too much Silent Hill going around. Anyway, here's the trailer. There's a bit where a monster gets his arm blown off and I actually whince. Poor freak.

Definitely one for the photorealism fans out there. But it's not just about admiring (?) the wobbling flesh and unhealthy pallor of your enemies, says the Steam page. Your weapons are designed to be a bit more frictional than your average FPS.

"Experience a comprehensive weapon system where malfunction checks, ammunition types, and mandatory maintenance are crucial. Feel the weight and realism of each weapon in the protagonist’s hands, thanks to procedural animation that considers physical characteristics."

Ill was once known as "Project Ill" and began life as a concept trailer from a couple of brothers making horribly detailed fear with Unreal Engine. Since then it has grown to become a realistic horror shooter, albeit one in which you'll still have to do the requisite video game crafting and scavenging.

item.title: You can soon take down James Bond's Le Chiffre in Hitman: World Of Assassination's latest Elusive Target
item.content:encoded:
https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/you-can-soon-take-down-james-bonds-le-chiffre-in-hitman-world-of-assassinations-latest-elusive-target

As played by Mads Mikkelsen

Earlier this week, IO Interactive showed the first trailer for their long-awaited Bond game, 007: First Light. Now they're bringing a bit of Bond back to their most famous creation, Hitman: World Of Assassination. Starting today, a new Elusive Target has been added to the game: Le Chiffre, as depicted Mads Mikkelsen in Casino Royale. There's a trailer below.

The new target was announced during this evening's Summer Game Fest stream. Apparently Mads will be added to Hitmads in a few hours from when I'm writing this, and will be available in-game to kill for 30 days. If you play it, you'll unlock some sort of reward in 007: First Light when it launches next year.

World Of Assassination is what the modern Hitman trilogy morphed into once IO Interactive had finished it and grown tired of releasing their games in the most complicated bundle of products possible. It contains all the levels and story modes from Hitman 1-3, various challenges modes, a roguelike mode, and a rotating cast of Elusive Targets, often based on celebrities or famed fictional characters. Mads is following in Sean Bean's footsteps, basically.

Whenever Le Chiffre arrives, you'll be able to grab it via Steam.

item.title: I Was Excited About The Deadpool Game Starring Neil Patrick Harris Until I Realized It Was Gonna Make Me Sick
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/deadpool-vr-trailer-neil-patrick-harris-meta-quest-1851783937

Geoff Keighley’s Summer Game Fest showcase is about halfway over, and the show hasn’t really had the sauce so far. I don’t mean in terms of the games it’s showing, I’m talking about the actual showmanship. Keighley’s stage show has been pretty paint-by-numbers without a lot of good bits and showmanship. That changed when he read a snarky letter from someone who wanted to show off a new game. As he recited the monologue, rough stick drawings appeared on the stage’s screen, eventually adorning the stage with Deadpool logos and crude drawings. The thought of a new game starring the Merc with a Mouth got my attention...until it was revealed to be a VR game.

Folks, I’m in Los Angeles right now for the Summer Game Fest event, and after spending so much less time in cars while living in New York City, I’ve gained a newfound disdain for things that give me motion sickness. I can’t get anywhere without becoming nauseous in the backseat of an Uber. This has plagued me every time I have tried a VR game over the past decade, and that means these games are a non-starter for me. So I guess y’all have fun with Deadpool VR. Maybe I’ll watch a Let’s Play.

Suggested Reading

This Narrative Adventure About Doomed Teenage Dinosaurs Feels Too Real

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

One cool thing is that Deadpool is voiced by How I Met Your Mother star Neil Patrick Harris this time around. Which, I don’t know, that’s fine. But I’m surprised. If you were going to go the stunt casting route, why not just pull Ryan Reynolds into the fold? Maybe he was too expensive.

Deadpool VR is coming to Meta Quest 3/3S later this year and is an exclusive for the headset at the moment. I wouldn’t be surprised to see it come to PlayStation VR down the line, though.

item.title: Multiplayer capture the flag shooter Last Flag announced for consoles, PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/multiplayer-capture-the-flag-shooter-last-flag-announced-for-consoles-pc

  • PC

Due out in 2026 from new studio founded by Imagine Dragons manager and lead singer.

Night Street Games, a studio founded by Imagine Dragons manager Mac Reynolds and lead singer Dan Reynolds, has announced Last Flag, a five-versus-five, capture the flag-based team third-person shooter. It will launch in 2026 for unspecified consoles and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store. Users can sign-up to playtest via the game’s official website.

“When I was in third grade, my ‘what do you want to be when you grow up’ answer was ‘run a video game studio,'” said Night Street Games CEO and co-founder Mac Reynolds in a press release. “Oddly specific, but I guess I really meant it. Dan and I grew up playing capture the flag in the woods at night with flashlights, friends, and lots of adrenaline. Last Flag is our attempt to honor the purity and magic of that hide and seek experience—brought to life by the incredible team of developers we’re lucky enough to stand beside.”

  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the game, via Night Street Games:

About

It’s 197X. The disco is sparkling, the crowd is roaring, and the most spectacular televised competition on the planet is about to begin.

Welcome to Last Flag—the game where fame, fortune, and your flag are all up for grabs.

Two teams. Two hidden flags. One shot at immortality.

Stash your flag. Find theirs. Snatch it. Run it back. Win.

The world is watching, so don’t forget to do it with style.

This isn’t war. This is showbiz.

From Night Street Games—an indie studio co-founded by Mac and Dan Reynolds (yep, from Imagine Dragons)—Last Flag is a five-versus-five team shooter built to bring CTF center stage. It’s fast, it’s fun, and delivers 20 minutes or less of non-stop chaos, clutch comebacks, and buzzer-beating plays.

You don’t get eliminated. You get vacuum-tubed off the set and reappear in the green room, ready to FWOOMP yourself back to a radar tower you control—or straight to your base.

Set in a funk-blasted 1970s-inspired universe, Last Flag transforms players into Contestants on the world’s most-watched game show—hosted by the mysterious media mogul Victor Fex.

When the cameras start rolling, players leap into an outdoor arena to hide their team’s flag, then scramble to reveal the enemy’s location by controlling radar towers and scouring the map’s multitude of hidden nooks and crannies.

Capture the flag. Haul it home. Defend it for one minute to win it.

Whether you’re celebrating your victory or vibing to the smooth sounds of defeat, you can always choose to run it back.

Key Features

  • CTF is the Main Event – Built from the ground up for Capture the Flag. Every mechanic—from sneaky flag placement to radar tower intel—is designed to create strategic tension, dramatic reversals, and last-second heroics.
  • 10 Contestants, 10 Big Personalities – From Masako, the heavy metal archer who screams as loud as she strikes, to Parker, the speedy scout and his trusty cybernetic falcon, every Contestant brings a distinct vibe, playstyle, and dramatic flair. Whether you’re stealing flags as Soo-Jin, the stealthy master thief, or locking enemies down with Julius Reeves’ Jail Cell—you can dig it—this crew was built to steal the show.
  • Themed Maps Set the Stage for Epic Action – Each colorful outdoor map was built to encourage exploration, thrilling team fights, and offers plenty of out-of-the-way hiding spots for concealing the flag. But it’s not all sunshine and rainbows in Last Flag… there may be more than meets the eye.
  • Original Soundtrack by Dan Reynolds and Friends – Fuzzy guitars, analog synths, and legit 1970s studio magic, crafted with real vintage gear by Dan, Grammy-nominated producer / writer JT Daly (Benson Boone, K.Flay, Bully), and Night Street Games’ own soundsmith Dave Lowmiller (Call of Duty: Modern Warfare, Battlefield, Dead Space).
  • Casually Competitive – No pressure. This isn’t a sweaty tactical shooter. It’s tight, fast, and fun gameplay that’s easy to jump into and hard to put down.
  • Everything Included at Launch – One affordable price. All the fun. Zero pay-to-win.

item.title: Marvel's Deadpool Brings The Merc With A Mouth To Virtual Reality
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/marvels-deadpool-brings-the-merc-with-a-mouth-to-virtual-reality/1100-6532179/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Summer Game Fest had plenty of big reveals, but perhaps the most surprising one was a brand-new Deadpool virtual reality game. Announced for Meta Quest 3 and Quest 3S VR headsets, this new game will see players control the merc with a mouth--voiced by actor Neil Patrick Harris--as he takes on classic villains like X-Men villains like Mojo and Lady Deathstrike.

Developer Twisted Pixel, known for a few other funny games, like 'Splosion Man, announced the game with a trailer that captures a lot of Deadpool's ridiculous banter, as well as a bunch of the flippy-shooty mayhem you'll get up to in the game. Watch it right here.

The game features an all-new, original Deadpool story that finds the quippy hero sucked through a portal to Mojoworld, where he's tasked with traveling across the Marvel universe to take on a bunch of villains. Gameplay combines shooting, stabbing, and parkour, and also looks to let you to leverage Deadpool's regenerative superpowers so you can get blown up and dismembered yourself, if that's what it takes to get the job done.

Marvel's Deadpool is set to launch later this year.

This isn't the first time that a VR game based on an iconic comic book character has been announced for Quest headsets, as last year saw the release of the highly acclaimed Batman: Arkham Shadow. The game earned positive reviews for translating the core Arkham experience into VR, as players were able to engage in detective work, stalk enemies, and brawl with them.

Meanwhile, several other Marvel games are in development right now. Marvel Cosmic Invasion looks like an old-school tribute to '90s beat-'em-ups, and the June State of Play livestream ended with a bang as Guilty Gear developer Arc System Works announced it was developing Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls.

The 4v4 fighting game features fresh redesigns of classic characters like Captain America and Iron Man, and it's scheduled to be out in 2026. Additionally, Arkane Lyon is currently working on a game starring vampire-hunter Blade, and Skydance Media's Marvel 1943: Rise of Hydra is currently scheduled to launch in 2026.

item.title: Dying Light: The Beast Smashes Through The Zombie Horde In August
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/dying-light-the-beast-smashes-through-the-zombie-horde-in-august/1100-6532167/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

A release date for Dying Light: The Beast was officially revealed during Summer Game Fest 2025, and this new chapter in Techland's open-world zombie series will arrive on August 22 for PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S.

The standalone adventure sees the return of Kyle Crane, Dying Light's original protagonist, and is set in the rural location of Castor Woods. After escaping from a decade in captivity and the horrific experiments performed on him by the Baron, Crane makes his way to the once-bustling tourist destination in search of vengeance and finds it overrun with zombies.

Like previous games, the infected people stalking the streets during the day will be the least of your worries, because once the sun sets, the worst of the zombie horde comes out to play. Fortunately, Crane has parkour skills and an off-road vehicle to help him outrun enemies, and when push comes to shove, the zombie DNA in his blood gives him an edge in combat.

Techland's new trailer showed off Crane's savage side, as he can now tap into his rage-fueled powers to smash through zombies. If brute force isn't enough, Crane can also make use of various melee weapons and firearms to even the odds. Priced at $60 for the standard edition, preorders will unlock the Hero of Harran Bundle. This includes the following DLC:

  • Ultimate Survivor Outfit
  • Harran Combat Knife
  • The Follower Crossbow

item.title: Shovel Knight Dev's Mina The Hollower Launches On Halloween, Demo Out Now
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/shovel-knight-devs-mina-the-hollower-launches-on-halloween-demo-out-now/1100-6532145/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Today, during Summer Game Fest Live with Geoff Keighley, Yacht Club Games announced that Mina The Hollower, its first new in-house IP since introducing Shovel Knight to the world in 2019, will launch on Halloween--and there's a free limited-time demo available on Steam right now.

Mina The Hollower is an action-adventure game made in the style of Game Boy Color-era games like The Legend Of Zelda: Oracle of Seasons/Ages. Players control the titular Mina, a mouse who's handy with a whip, as she travels through a spooky island in an attempt to save it from a dreadful curse.

The demo was released on Steam in conjunction with the release-date announcement, and it is part of the annual Steam Next Fest celebration, which ends on June 16th. The demo contains the game's opening stage and first major boss fight, and all progress made in the demo will carry over to the main game when it launches in the fall.

Mina was first announced in February 2022 as part of a Yacht Club Presents livestream presentation. Yacht Club's last update on the game was during last year's Yacht Club Presents, where Yacht Club's Alec Faulkner walked through some of the game's top features.

Yacht Club Games has been busy outside of Mina The Hollower, however, as the studio has released multiple updates for roguelike Shovel Knight Dig and puzzler Shovel Knight Pocket Dungeon. Another Shovel Knight project, the upgraded Shovel Of Hope DX, was announced during a Nintendo Indie World last year as well.

Mina The Hollower launches October 31, but PC is the only platform confirmed as of this writing.
